summary: Active hardware and software level researcher in software and hardware AI labs at Berkeley; 5 years of experience in machine learning model research & development and C/C++ level hardware optimization; Generalist AI experience from past work in AI software companies, and large scale hardware companies; Patent involving AI sports analytics, and research publication in medical computer vision

project_experiences.name: Near Memory Computing
project_experiences.description: Implementing operations to speed up ResNet50 on RISCV system-on-chip using Berkeley’s Chipyard and Chisel framework. Implementing near memory computing controllers to speed up memory access and reduce unnecessary scratchpad usage.

project_experiences.name: Human Brain Neuron Generation
project_experiences.description: Implemented SimCLR, BYOL, and DINO state of the art self supervised learning computer vision techniques to build strong AI representations, and visualized model training and evaluation using MLFlow.

project_experiences.name: AI Application Job Bot
project_experiences.description: Built a bot leveraging retrieval augmented generation (RAG) using OpenAI’s gpt-3 & 4 models, LangChain, and the Qdrant vector database to automatically search for jobs, align your resume to the job, and answer any questions. Leveraged prompt engineering techniques to reduce large language model hallucination, and automation techniques like Selenium and BeautifulSoup to submit applications. Resulted in a 10% increase in views, and 5% increase in job response rate.

work_experiences.description: Implemented AI-based ball tracking algorithms using TensorFlow. Developed YOLO model and trained to perform action recognition with 85% accuracy. Utility Patent on final algorithm. Used AMD’s profiling technology to locate GPU throttling code on NVIDIA’s Jetson board. Wrote C++ CUDA kernels to parallelize atomic operations.

Implemented research papers from MIT’s Zhang Lab to compute guide RNAs for CRISPR usage. Leveraged AI algorithms like AlphaFold to visualize PDBs of downstream algorithm usage, leading to 2-3 month speedup towards initial clinical trials.

Built core computer vision system in PyTorch on technology to auto generate large scale training datasets using diffusion models from small input of training data + human feedback. Leveraged a reinforcement-learning based neural architecture search optimizer. Implemented recent papers. Demo led to seed funding from angel investors.

relevant_coursework: Structure and Interpretation of Computer Programs
Designing Information Devices and Systems I

publications.title: Melanoma Diagnosis Using Convolutional Neural Networks

certificates.name: deeplearning.ai TensorFlow Developer Certification
highlights: Developed and achieved proficiency in building models in the computer vision, natural language processing, and time series domain.

entries.name: Ball detection and tracking device, system and method
